title: 13 Wedding Guest Dresses You'll Want to Wear on Repeat, Including Sydney Sweeney's
description: It's no secret that getting a gorgeous letter-pressed wedding invitation in the mail brings immediate excitement. Your eyes quickly scan the location and before you know it, you're on Pinterest gathering a mood board or scrolling through Farfetch to find that standout ensemble that'll earn you the title of best-dressed for the night. As exhilarating as the search for the perfect wedding guest dress can be, it can easily get stressful when there's a dress code involved. We have nothing against them, but a dress code has the power to make your shopping escapade a breeze or a headache - especially when they're unofficial. Wedding attire has become unconventional in recent years, but apparently, stern rules still apply if you're Sydney Sweeney. The "Anyone But You" star recently caused a stir for wearing a blue corset dress (that's close to white) to co-star Glen Powell's sister's wedding. The viral outfit has left the internet divided on what's acceptable wedding attire versus what isn't. But let's be real, you can wear anything you want to a wedding. We've seen everything from TikTok trends done right like the stomach pudge dress to guests dressed in all-white that's totally cosigned by the bride herself (just like Solange Knowles's iconic ceremony). Surely, a blue dress is more than acceptable, too. Whether you're attending an upcoming wine-country wedding that's sure to be warm or an indoor ceremony with a cocktail party dress code (that's not super strict), we found a handful of wedding guest dresses that are bound to catch your eye. From florals for spring to formal pieces that are equal parts boundary-pushing and stylish, we've gathered our top picks that you'll want to wear on repeat. Now all that's left is to pick out something from the registry and get it wrapped in time - easy peasy. Shop our top wedding guest dresses ahead.
author: Haley Lyndes

Its made of 100 percent cotton, making for a breathable yet stylish outfit.ciaobycc.comAll-White DressCiao By CC Charlize Dress ($195) Even though the dress code says all-white, that doesn't mean you can't stand out. This romantic number from Ciao By CC takes the classic slip dress to a new level of elegance with its figure-flattering silhouette and rosette choker.showmeyourmumu.comAn Icy Blue DressShow Me Your Mumu Bella Maxi Dress ($198)In case you're feeling like Sydney Sweeney, this maxi dress is the perfect wedding guest outfit. It features adjustable shoulder straps for a classic fit and a draped chiffon neckline for that Old-Hollywood glamour, allowing you to freely dance the night away.revolve.comA Long-Sleeved DressHelsa Aesther Jersey Dress ($328) In case you're looking for something with more coverage, consider this mint frock from Helsa. We're not only obsessed with its princess-like hem but also its bow cutout that cascades the back — the epitome of dainty meets sultry. thereformation.comA Fun Floral DressReformation Kastoria Dress ($378) It's hard to go wrong with a floral dress, especially for spring and summer weddings. It also comes in other colorways like peach and light yellow floral. It's the same silhouette as the one Sweeney wore.Net-a-PorterA Pink Tiered DressAje Fleur Strapless Ruffled Tiered Gauze Gown ($695) Unless the theme is black tie, you can never go wrong with a pop of color for a wedding. Naomi has also lent her skillful pen to Essence Girls United, Elle, Bustle, and Elite Daily. When she's not crafting shopping roundups, high-profile features, beauty op-eds, or trend guides, you can find Naomi behind her blog "Eli-Nay," where she inspires readers through style guides, cultural pieces, and innovative content on her Instagram.
html:
Skip to main content

13 Wedding Guest Dresses You'll Want to Wear on Repeat, Including Sydney Sweeney's

While each product featured is independently selected by our editors, we may include paid promotion. If you buy something through our links, we may earn commission. Read more about our Product Review Guidelines here.

It's no secret that getting a gorgeous letter-pressed wedding invitation in the mail brings immediate excitement. Your eyes quickly scan the location and before you know it, you're on Pinterest gathering a mood board or scrolling through Farfetch to find that standout ensemble that'll earn you the title of best-dressed for the night. As exhilarating as the search for the perfect wedding guest dress can be, it can easily get stressful when there's a dress code involved. We have nothing against them, but a dress code has the power to make your shopping escapade a breeze or a headache — especially when they're unofficial.

Wedding attire has become unconventional in recent years, but apparently, stern rules still apply if you're Sydney Sweeney. The "Anyone But You" star recently caused a stir for wearing a blue corset dress (that's close to white) to co-star Glen Powell's sister's wedding. The viral outfit has left the internet divided on what's acceptable wedding attire versus what isn't.

But let's be real, you can wear anything you want to a wedding. We've seen everything from TikTok trends done right like the stomach pudge dress to guests dressed in all-white that's totally cosigned by the bride herself (just like Solange Knowles's iconic ceremony). Surely, a blue dress is more than acceptable, too.

Whether you're attending an upcoming wine-country wedding that's sure to be warm or an indoor ceremony with a cocktail party dress code (that's not super strict), we found a handful of wedding guest dresses that are bound to catch your eye. From florals for spring to formal pieces that are equal parts boundary-pushing and stylish, we've gathered our top picks that you'll want to wear on repeat. Now all that's left is to pick out something from the registry and get it wrapped in time — easy peasy. Shop our top wedding guest dresses ahead.

A Corset Dress

V. Chapman The Carmen Dress in Halogen Blue ($585)

In case Sweeney has you feeling inspired to wear blue to your next wedding, we found the exact dress she wore from V. Chapman. From its delicate ruffle details adorning the hem to its front slit, you'll want to wear this dress beyond a celebration of love.

A One-Shoulder Dress

Superdown Crystal Mini Dress ($84)

This dazzling one-shoulder number isn't your average wedding guest dress, but it's just as classy as a maxi pick. Complete with a flirty side cutout and wrap skirt overlay, this dress is perfect for summer soirées.

A Lightweight Maxi Dress

Moon River Sleeveless Corset Top Maxi Dress ($102)

For the casual wedding you're attending this year, like a laid-back destination on the beach, this blue pick from Moon River should be your go-to. Its made of 100 percent cotton, making for a breathable yet stylish outfit.

All-White Dress

Ciao By CC Charlize Dress ($195)

Even though the dress code says all-white, that doesn't mean you can't stand out. This romantic number from Ciao By CC takes the classic slip dress to a new level of elegance with its figure-flattering silhouette and rosette choker.

An Icy Blue Dress

Show Me Your Mumu Bella Maxi Dress ($198)

In case you're feeling like Sydney Sweeney, this maxi dress is the perfect wedding guest outfit. It features adjustable shoulder straps for a classic fit and a draped chiffon neckline for that Old-Hollywood glamour, allowing you to freely dance the night away.

A Long-Sleeved Dress

Helsa Aesther Jersey Dress ($328)

In case you're looking for something with more coverage, consider this mint frock from Helsa. We're not only obsessed with its princess-like hem but also its bow cutout that cascades the back — the epitome of dainty meets sultry.

A Fun Floral Dress

Reformation Kastoria Dress ($378)

It's hard to go wrong with a floral dress, especially for spring and summer weddings. At the same time, the concept can be expected, but fortunately this Reformation pick is anything but basic. With its full skirt and classy print, you'll feel instantly royal. It also comes with removeable straps in case you want a slightly different look.

A Striking Halterneck Dress

Retrofête Reiss Dress ($389, originally $648)

In case you've been looking for the perfect dress for that evening wedding you're highly anticipating, consider this Retrofête piece the answer to your shopping problems. With its halterneck, captivating gunmetal fabric, and detachable sash, you'll never want to take this dress off.

A Black Dress

Faithfull Bijou Asymmetric Dress ($520)

The classic LBD has evolved over the years, and we're loving this iteration from Faithfull — complete with an asymmetrical fringed hem and draped shoulder.

A Ruffle Dress

V. Chapman Carmen Corset Front-Slit Ruffled Gown ($585)

A customer favorite, this blue floral gown comes with a corset bodice with gathered bust cups, adjustable back lacing, and a bow you can tie in the back. It also comes in other colorways like peach and light yellow floral. It's the same silhouette as the one Sweeney wore.

A Pink Tiered Dress

Aje Fleur Strapless Ruffled Tiered Gauze Gown ($695)

Unless the theme is black tie, you can never go wrong with a pop of color for a wedding. With this magenta piece from Aje, all you need are some strappy heels and gold jewelry, and you're ready to celebrate love in the most stylish way.

A Frock That Pops

Alémais Dahlia Floral Linen-Blend Maxi Dress ($790)

"The White Lotus" Season 3 has us obsessed with Alémais lately, and this vibrant dress is a gorgeous find. Whether you're going to a garden wedding or morning ceremony, this pick makes a sophisticated yet sexy statement.

— Additional reporting by Rebecca Brown and Naomi Parris

Haley Lyndes is a shopping writer and editor with more than seven years of experience in the publishing space. Specializing in home and lifestyle, she covers everything from furniture and mattresses to beauty products and fitness gear. Previously, she was an SEO commerce writer for Apartment Therapy and The Kitchn. Her writing has appeared in Buzzfeed, Travel & Leisure, and Real Simple. When she's not reviewing her latest home finds or interviewing celebrities, you'll likely find her out for a run — she's also a marathoner.

Rebecca Brown is a former PS editor and contributor.

Naomi Parris is the assistant shopping editor at PS, based in New York. With over eight years of experience and previous roles held on the brand's Beauty and Operations teams, she enjoys telling stories that merge fashion, beauty, and Black culture. Naomi has also lent her skillful pen to Essence Girls United, Elle, Bustle, and Elite Daily. When she's not crafting shopping roundups, high-profile features, beauty op-eds, or trend guides, you can find Naomi behind her blog "Eli-Nay," where she inspires readers through style guides, cultural pieces, and innovative content on her Instagram.
